channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Intel plans to slash 25,000 jobs in 2025 as new CEO warns, ‘There are no more blank checks’
item.description: CEO Lip-Bu Tan sent a memo informing employees of significant ongoing layoffs and cost-cutting.

item.title: S&P 500 sets 5 all-time highs in one trading week
item.description: On Friday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite added 0.2% to its own record set the day before.

item.title: Trump defeats Australia’s mad cow disease restrictions in deal to ship American beef overseas
item.description: The Trump's administration claimed it as a major victory over “non-scientific trade barriers.”

item.title: Trump says he may want to give you a tariff rebate check: ‘A little rebate for people of a certain income level might be very nice’
item.description: Trump has been busy in July, with a deal to bring real sugar back to (some) Coke recipes, a visit to the Federal Reserve, and demands about a sports t...

item.title: From ‘diversity of viewpoints’ to ‘cowardly capitulation,’ the Paramount/Skydance merger clears in a storm of controversy
item.description: “Americans no longer trust the legacy national news media to report fully, accurately, and fairly. It is time for a change," FCC Commissioner Brendan ...

item.title: Dow up over 200 points, S&P 500 and Nasdaq eye fresh records — follow live
Wall Street's 'fear gauge' falls to lowest since February as stocks set records
Dow ends up over 200 points, S&P 500 and Nasdaq close at record highs again
As S&P 500 soars to record after record, the Dow’s been left behind. What gives?
This chart shows how prices have gone up because of Trump’s tariffs
